item.title: How to create a GenomicRanges object in Bioconductor using canonical transcripts
item.description: To not miss a post like this, sign up for my newsletter to learn computational biology and bioinformatics. Introduction to Annotation Data Packages in Bioconductor Accurate gene and transcript annotation is the foundation of many bioinformatics workflows, including RNA-seq analysis, functional genomics, and variant annotation. In the R/Bioconductor ecosystem, dedicated annotation data packages make it easy for researchers to access, query, and leverage gene models sourced from major biological databases.
